newsitem.title: USA: Cornerstone, Dutch Institutional in pact.
newsitem.headline: Cornerstone, Dutch Institutional in pact.

text.p: Cornerstone Properties Inc said Monday it had agreed to buy Dutch Institutional Holding Co Inc's interests in up to nine U.S. office buildings totaling 4.5 million square feet for $1.055 billion in stock, debt and cash.
Dutch Institutional is the U.S. real estate subsidiary of the Dutch pension fund Pensioenfonds PGGM.

The deal will make PGGM Cornerstone's largest investor, Cornerstone said. The office buildings are located in the Atlanta, Boston, Charlotte, N.C., and Washington markets and are 96 percent leased, Cornerstone said.

Under a definitive agreement between the companies, total consideration will be about 34.2 million shares of Cornerstone common priced at $16 per share (totaling $547 million of equity), $250 million in purchase money mortgage debt, and $258 million cash. Pricing of the transaction was established as of a reference date of June 18, 1997.

"This transaction is consistent with our objective of converting our U.S. real estate investment from ownership of individual properties to an investment in a successful real estate operating company," said Robert Sorrentino, executive vice president and chief financial officer of Dutch Institutional.
"We share Cornerstone Properties's philosophy of investing in high-quality assets in major markets and look forward to a long and productive relationship with the company," he said.
